task_summary: Mobile robot navigates down a corridor to reach the named goal location, retrying if necessary and verifying arrival.

task_long_description.overview: The scene shows a dim hallway with doors and a corridor centerline progressing forward across frames. The robotâ€™s task is pure navigation: reach the named waypoint 'goal' at the far end of the corridor. The behavior tree first checks whether it is already at the goal, otherwise it executes a timed navigation action with bounded retries, then confirms arrival. No manipulation is required; perception relies on corridor geometry and the distant goal.
preconditions: Robot is localized in the hallway map.
The goal location 'goal' exists in the navigation map.
Base is free to move; path is unobstructed.
stepwise_plan: If already at the goal, succeed immediately.
Otherwise, attempt NavigateToNamed(goal) with a time budget.
Retry up to three attempts if the navigation action fails or times out.
success_criteria: Robot pose is within the goal region.
Final verification condition IsAt(goal) evaluates to true.
No collisions or safety violations occurred.
failure_and_recovery: If navigation times out or fails, RetryUntilSuccessful triggers new attempts.
If repeated failures occur, the tree returns failure to allow higher-level recovery (not modeled here).
task_long_description.termination: Tree returns SUCCESS once IsAt(goal) is true; otherwise returns FAILURE after retries are exhausted.

frame_3.now_evidence: Corridor alignment and vanishing point are clear, indicating directed progress toward the far end.
frame_3.predicts_next: Continued forward motion; confirms goal direction straight ahead.

node_specs.description: Checks if the robot is already at the named target.
Send base to a named map waypoint with heading and time budget.
Retry child up to K attempts until it returns SUCCESS.
Abort child if it exceeds the specified time budget.
Run children in order; stop on first failure.
Try children in order until one succeeds.

failure_modes: Localization drift causing IsAt(goal) to remain false.
Planner failure or oscillation near doors.
recovery_strategy: If still failing, escalate to higher-level replan or alternative route (not modeled).
assumptions: Frames depict a straight corridor; the goal lies forward along the hallway. The exact goal marker is not visible; we assume it corresponds to a mapped waypoint named 'goal'.

expected_success_criteria: IsAt(goal) condition is true at the end of the sequence.
